ISSUE.TITLE: sqlite: podman container commit: container already exists
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: Seen just now in [f36 rootless sqlite](https://api.cirrus-ci.com/v1/artifact/task/5923828761624576/html/sys-podman-fedora-36-rootless-host-sqlite.log.html#t--00381) ``` $ podman container commit -q c1 Error: more than one result for container "c1": container already exists ```

BUGGYCOMMIT.MESSAGE: Merge pull request #17896 from willmerae/willmerae-patch-1 [CI:DOCS] minor grammar fix in `--volume` description

COMMIT.MESSAGE: Ensure that SQLite state handles name-ID collisions If a container with an ID starting with "db1" exists, and a container named "db1" also exists, and they are different containers - if I run `podman inspect db1` the container named "db1" should be inspected, and there should not be an error that multiple containers matched the name or id "db1". This was already handled by BoltDB, and now is properly managed by SQLite. Fixes #17905 Signed-off-by: Matt Heon <mheon@redhat.com>
